column4: hi everyone, I'm trying to set up a (very simple) local dns server
what's the best way to do so? I just need to forward example.com to 192.15.1.50
use dnsmasq... install it and... um... done
by default it is configured to listen on all interfaces and forward to the dns servers in /etc/resolv.conf
thanks, when I try to install I get this error "Address already in use"
uninstall any other dns server first
I don't know of any.... how could I check for any installed?
what have you installed so far?
nothing, this is a fresh install
that doesn't sound okay... Can you pm me the output of "history | grep apt" ?
sorry, I'm typing this on my laptop, having trouble copying it over
it is probably not mounted now
how would I go about remounting it?
find the partition for it using gparted... you are looking for something like /dev/sda4
